Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • Car
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Saab95, Volvo240

    public abstract class Car
extends java.lang.Object
implements Movable
    This in an abstract class which collects mutual varibles and methods of the two subclasses Volo240 and Saab95. The class imports a math class to enable the equation required to complete the move method. The Car class implements the interface Movable which contains the three crucial methods move(), turnright(),turnleft().

      We create a constructor to set the variables we need when creating an object.

      • startEngine

        public void startEngine()
        This method is public do to the fact that someone (e.g. a class, driver) will use the method to start the car. We set currentSpeed to 0.1 to give the car a speed bigger than 0.

      • stopEngine

        public void stopEngine()
        This method is public do to the fact that someone (e.g. a class, driver) will use the method to turn the car off. We set currentSpeed to 0.

      • speedFactor

        protected abstract double speedFactor()

      • move

        public void move()
        The method changes the x and y coordinates of the car and will be used in the separate subclasses. CurrentSpeed is equal to dx and dy. The method uses a unit circle where sines and cosines is used to represent the direction of the new coordinate. By default the car moves straight forward.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Movable

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft()
        This method enables the car to turn and here we decide the size of the degree. By incrementing with 90 degrees the car turns left.
        Specified by:
        turnLeft in interface Movable

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight()
        This method enables the car to turn and here we decide the size of the degree. By decrementing with 90 degrees the car turns right.
        Specified by:
        turnRight in interface Movable

      • gas

        public void gas(double amount)
         throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method will give the car a new speed based on the "amount" value and higher than the current speed. The usage of the incrementSpeed method secures that the speed is always increasing. We make sure that the method only can accept values between 0 and 1 with the the if-statement. When the user inserts a value higher than 1 or lower than 0 the program throws a exception.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException

      • brake

        public void brake(double amount)
           throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method will give the car a new speed based on the "amount" value and lower than the current speed. The usage of the decrementSpeed method secures that the speed is always deceasing. We make sure that the method only can accept values between 0 and 1 with the the if-statement. When the user inserts a value higher than 1 or lower than 0 the program throws a exception.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException
